726838f-b.title: Queens: Hawtree Avenue - 115th Avenue
726838f-b.text:
Hawtree Ave., east side, south of One Hundred Fifteenth Ave.
line, partially in 124th Street, showing in a set of three views
an old barn on the property of J. Lott from 1859 to 1873. G. Griffin
was the owner in 1891. It was subsequently purchased by the Metronolis
lLand Company of 302 Broadway New York. This barn was erected on May
24, 1813 by William C. Stoothoff, whose family occupied a homestead on
the west side of Hawtree Ave., north of vne Hundred Fourteenth Avenue
to a point slichtly north of One Hundred Ninth Avenue from 1859-1891.
In 1922 the J.C. 2ook Ormanization had possession of the Lott homes.
This farmhouse was northwest of this barn, between Hawtree Ave., and
124th Street in One Hundred Fifteenth Ave. View No. 3 shows the in-
terior, the others the exterior of the barn.
1922.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MA BE REPRODUCED.
